sentence.Network_en: Researchers observed one bird impale a rodent on a cactus.
sentence.Network_cn: 研究人员观察到一只鸟把一只啮齿动物钉在一棵仙人掌上。

sentence.Network_en: When there is a full moon, this nocturnal rodent is careful to stay in its burrow.
sentence.Network_cn: 月圆之夜，这种夜间活动的啮齿类动物会小心地呆在地洞里不出来。

sentence.Network_en: 'The rat,'said O'Brien, still addressing his invisible audience,'although a rodent, is carnivorous.

list.abs: ...沟、前额等处。皮损初起为灰白色或蜡样小结节，质硬，缓慢增大并出现溃疡，绕以珍珠状向内卷曲的隆起边缘，又称侵蚀性溃疡（rodent ulcer）（图27-13）。偶见皮损呈侵袭性扩大，或向深部生长，破坏眼、鼻，甚至穿通颅骨，侵及硬脑膜，造成患者.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: from Latin rodent- 'gnawing', from the verb rodere

encyclopedia.content: Rodentia is an order of mammals also known as rodents, characterised by two continuously-growing incisors in the upper and lower jaws which must be kept short by gnawing.

entry.def: Rodents are small mammals which have sharp front teeth. Rats, mice, and squirrels are rodents.

means.word_mean: 1. relatively small gnawing animals having a single pair of constantly growing incisor teeth specialized for gnawing

sentences.en: Rodents carry diseases and are generally regarded as pests.
